name: Closed Opp Bulk API2.0 Trigger New CRM

properties.label: Webhook type
properties.hint: Select the HTTP method and payload data type used by webhook. Learn more
properties.name: webhook_type

properties.label: Payload schema
properties.empty_schema_title: Describe all fields in your response.
properties.name: payload_schema

input.query: select id, opportunitynumber__c from opportunity where ( FulfillmentChannel__c != 'Cloud Service Provider' AND (StageName = 'Closed Booked' AND (CloseDate = LAST_N_MONTHS:5) AND OpportunityType__c != 'Overlay Credit' and OpportunityType__c != 'Master Claim' AND Forecast_Category__c != 'Omitted' AND ((NOT(amount < 0 or amount = 0)) or amount > 0) AND (NOT Name LIKE 'Opp-NFR') AND (NOT Order_Type__c Like '%Training%' ) and Order_Type__c != null and FulfillmentChannel__c <> 'Webstore' AND (Super_Region__c = 'APAC' or Super_Region__c = 'EMEA' or Super_Region__c = 'NA' or Super_Region__c = 'LATAM')))

extended_output_schema.hint: Number of lines in the resulting CSV
extended_output_schema.label: Number of rows
extended_output_schema.name: result_lines

extended_output_schema.hint: FileStorage file path (conditional, based on output type selected)
extended_output_schema.label: FileStorage file path
extended_output_schema.name: wf_output_full_path

extended_input_schema.empty_list_text: At least one data-source must be provided.
extended_input_schema.empty_list_title: Multiple data-sources can be added to perform `join` operations.

extended_input_schema.label: Data Sources
extended_input_schema.name: sources

properties.label: Data source name
properties.hint: Provide an alias name for the data source. E.g: contacts, orders. This name is to be used in the query.
properties.name: table_name

properties.label: Data source type
properties.hint:
Provide the data source type. To pass file content directly from upstream action/trigger chooser Content Stream.
                   You can also refer to a file in Workato FileStorage or a table from Data tables.
properties.name: data_source_type

properties.label: Content input stream
properties.hint: Pass the contents or file contents reference pill here from an upstream action or trigger.
properties.name: source_stream

properties.label: FileStorage file

toggle_field.label: FileStorage file
toggle_field.hint: Choose the file to fetch the data
toggle_field.name: wf_file_path

properties.hint: Provide the FileStorage file full path here to fetch the data. For example, “samplepath/filename.csv”.
properties.name: wf_file_path

properties.label: Data table
properties.hint: Select a data table to fetch the data.
properties.name: table_id

properties.label: File format
properties.hint: Choose the data format . Today CSV and Excel file formats are supported.
properties.name: file_format

properties.label: jq expression
properties.hint: Provide a jq expression to convert your JSON data into CSV format. For example, .items[] | [ keys[] as $k | .[$k] ] | @csv.
properties.name: json_jq_expression

properties.label: Worksheet
properties.hint: Provide the sheet name from the Excel file where the data is available.
properties.name: excel_sheet_name

properties.label: Range
properties.hint: Provide the cell range of the data. e.g A5:F2000. Make sure to include the header row if the schema type selected is ‘Infer’.
properties.name: excel_range

properties.label: Column schema type
properties.hint:
Choose ‘Define' to provide column names and types explicitly in the action.
                   Choose ‘Dynamic’ to pass schema as array data pill from upstream action.
                   Choose ‘Infer’ to infer column names and schema automatically from the data and its header.
properties.name: schema_type

properties.label: Data schema
properties.empty_schema_title: Provide column names in your CSV.
properties.empty_schema_message: <button type="button" data-action="generateSchema">Use a sample CSV file</button> to input all column names at once.
properties.hint: Describe the column schema of the data in this data source.
properties.name: table_schema

properties.label: Data schema
properties.hint: Provide the data pill with a schema.
properties.name: dynamic_table_schema

properties.label: Data schema
properties.empty_schema_title: Provide column names in your data source.
properties.empty_schema_message: Provide all column names within the selected range
properties.hint: Describe the schema of the columns of the data source.
properties.name: excel_table_schema

properties.label: Data schema
properties.hint: Provide the sheet name from the Excel file where the data is available.
properties.name: excel_dynamic_table_schema

properties.label: Column relaxation
properties.hint: Select Yes if the incoming source data may contain additional columns than the schema provided. Select No to exactly match schema with the data, and it returns error if additional columns are encountered.

toggle_field.label: Column relaxation
toggle_field.hint: Select Yes if the incoming source data may contain additional columns than the schema provided. Select No to exactly match schema with the data, and it returns error if additional columns are encountered.
toggle_field.name: allow_relaxed_schema

properties.name: allow_relaxed_schema

properties.label: Contains header
properties.hint: Select Yes if the incoming data contains header as the first row. If so, SQL transformations will understand the columns in the file by name matching the first row in the file with the schema provided. If No is chosen, the column schema provided will be matched to the order of the columns in the file from left to right.

toggle_field.label: Contains header
toggle_field.hint: Select Yes if the incoming data contains header as the first row. If so, SQL transformations will understand the columns in the file by name matching the first row in the file with the schema provided. If No is chosen, the column schema provided will be matched to the order of the columns in the file from left to right.
toggle_field.name: csv_ignore_header

properties.name: csv_ignore_header

properties.label: Contains header
properties.hint: Set to Yes if the Excel range contain a header row that needs to be ignored. Default is set to No.

toggle_field.label: Contains header
toggle_field.hint: Set to Yes if the Excel range contain a header row that needs to be ignored. Default is set to No.
toggle_field.name: excel_ignore_header

properties.name: excel_ignore_header

properties.label: Header matching
properties.hint: Choose how to match header with schema columns
properties.name: matching_mode

properties.label: Column delimiter
properties.hint: Select the character that separates columns in the CSV contents. Default is set to comma.
properties.name: csv_delimiter

properties.label: Query parameters
schema_field_name_regex: Query parameter names only allow alphanumerical symbols and underscore (_)
properties.hint:
Add the parameters to be used in the WHERE condition of the query below. e.g. id.
Next, add the actual parameter value, which can be static or datapills.
Select the closest corresponding data type that your database is expecting for the bind variable
properties.name: parameters

properties.label: SQL query
properties.hint: Add SQL select statement to query one or more data sources. Joins and more complex functions are also supported, more details available here. To add parameters in the WHERE condition, use bind variables notation, e.g. id = @id, where id denotes the field name from the parameters section above.
properties.name: sql_select_query
